alert.note: Alert for Louisa; Muscatine (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 05 at 3:32AM CST until March 09 at 11:00AM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Cedar River near Conesville affecting Muscatine and Louisa Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cedar River near Conesville. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Water affects residences along County Road F70. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM CST Sunday the stage was 12.8 feet. - The Cedar River at Conesville continues to slowly rise. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 13.8 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued this afternoon.
